column1: The LCD uses technology called electro-optical modulation. This means it uses electricity to change how much light passes through it.Each pixel (block) of an LCD is made of a thin layer of molecules between two electrodes and two polarizing filters. The electrodes provide electric power to the liquid crystal layer
column2: and don't block the light. Light travels with 'polarity' or direction
column3: and a polarizing filter only lets light with one kind of polarity to go through it
column4: like trying to slide a ruler through a narrow opening. Only when the ruler is lined up right
column5: will it fit. These two filters are perpendicular to one another
column6: so the narrow openings are in different directions. This means that without the liquid crystals between them
column7: they would block all light from passing through – whatever light gets through the first filter will not fit through the second filter
